topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 1.1: Configuring LDAP 3

body.p: If you installed HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 1.1, your system was configured to use LDAP v2. LDAP (Lightweight Directory Access Protocol) is a protocol that programs use to look up information from a server.
This document explains how to configure HP Helion OpenStack to use LDAP v3.
NOTE: If you installed HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade after *****, you do not need to perform these steps. Your installation configured LDAP v3 upon installation.

ol.li:
Execute the following commands to modify the stackrc file. The stackrc file is a configuration file contains all of the settings that control the services started and the repositories used to download the source for those services.
export OS_PASSWORD=admin export OS_USERNAME=admin export OS_TENANT_NAME=admin export OS_AUTH_URL=https://10.200.52.100:5000/v2.0 export OS_CACERT=/etc/stunnel/ssl/hlm/certs/ca.crt export OS_REGION_NAME=memphis unset OS_PROJECT_DOMAIN_NAME unset OS_USER_DOMAIN_ID unset OS_IDENTITY_API_VERSION unset OS_AUTH_VERSION unset OS_PROJECT_NAME
Execute the following commands to source the stackrc file: source stackrc
Execute the following OpenStack CLI command to create a new project: openstack project create ldapdemo --domain americas
Make note of the domain-id in the command output.
Execute the following command to list all user names: openstack user list --domain Americas
Make note of the ID number for the cg-ldap-admin user.
Execute the following command to add the cg-ldap-admin user to the project you created as an admin. openstack role add --user <user id> --project ldapdemo admin
Execute the following commands to source the stackrc file: source stackrc

Execute the following commands to modify the stackrc file. The stackrc file is a configuration file contains all of the settings that control the services started and the repositories used to download the source for those services.
export OS_USERNAME=ldapuser1 export OS_PASSWORD=init123# export OS_PROJECT_NAME=ldap_project1 export OS_TENANT_NAME=ldap_project1 export OS_PROJECT_DOMAIN_NAME=americas export OS_USER_DOMAIN_ID=c1f0e239545f428fb53128650ae23771 export OS_IDENTITY_API_VERSION=3 export OS_AUTH_VERSION=3 export OS_AUTH_URL=https://10.20.4.100:5000/v3 export OS_AUTH_URL=http://10.20.3.103:35357/v3 export OS_CACERT=/etc/stunnel/ssl/hlm/certs/ca.crt export OS_REGION_NAME=memphis
Edit the /etc/nova/nova.conf file to comment out the following line: #auth_version = 2.0

Modify the /etc/cinder/api-paste.ini file as follows:
Replace paste.filter_factory = keystoneclient.middleware.auth_token:filter_factory
With: paste.filter_factory = keystonemiddleware.auth_token:filter_factory

Modify the /etc/glance/glance-api-paste.ini file as follows:
Replace paste.filter_factory = keystoneclient.middleware.auth_token:filter_factory
With: paste.filter_factory = keystonemiddleware.auth_token:filter_factory

Modify the /etc/glance/glance-registry-paste.ini file as follows:
Replace paste.filter_factory = keystoneclient.middleware.auth_token:filter_factory
With: paste.filter_factory = keystonemiddleware.auth_token:filter_factory

Modify the /etc/glance/glance-registry.conf file as follows:
Replace paste.filter_factory = keystoneclient.middleware.auth_token:filter_factory
With: paste.filter_factory = keystonemiddleware.auth_token:filter_factory

Execute the following commands to restart affected OpenStack services:
service glance-registry restart service glance-api restart service cinder-api restart service nova-api restart
